headline: Management and Program Analyst at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
Seasoned Logistics professional with over ten years experience in the military to include two combat deployments. Specializing in logistics readiness, inventory control, property management, and analysis.

Specialties: Military operations, operations research, logistics, operations planning and management

positions.description:
Conducts strategic and operational analysis in support of the Army Staff, Joint Staff, Office of the Secretary of Defense, and Combatant Commanders.  Provide relevant and reliable analysis as part of force protection and integration plans, contingency operations and modernization plans in support of the Total Army Analysis and Quadrennial Defense Review
â      Lead of a complex study developing Army force movement requirements for one of the Integrated Security Construct scenarios currently under development by the Office of the Secretary of Defense
â     Evaluated movement requirements, lift asset and container availability over time for retrograde of unit equipment and theater provided equipment to return from Operation Iraqi Freedom                                    
â   Expertise in standard and non-standard Army equipment assisted study team members in identifying equipment dimensional characteristics for over 400 pieces for a study being conducted for the USF-I, J4
positions.title: Military Operations Research Analyst

positions.description:
Directly supervised 5 personnel.  Senior Logistics Manager in the organization. Responsible for equipping deploying units in support of overseas contingency operations; coordinate logistics support for training and operations; provide guidance to the commander and establish policy for logistics programs within the organization.
.â    Resourced and coordinated the movement of 70 personnel and 30 vehicles to Haiti within 72 hours
â     Improved the organizationâs equipment transfer and turn-in rate by 24% 
â     Initiated and tracked 16 contracts and fund transfers of over $1.5 million in preparation for deployment
â     Managed five logistics programs within the organization to ensure regulatory compliance and operational readiness
positions.title: Battalion Logistics Officer

positions.description:
Directly supervised 8 personnel.  Operations Manager of a Sustainment Brigade Troops Battalion. Manage the training program that includes all planning, coordination, and execution of training events and assessments. Manage daily operations within the organization to include long range planning; Develop new equipment fielding plans and supervises the preparation, publication, supervision and execution of all directives.
â    Developed and managed the redeployment plan for over 700 personnel and equipment 
â    Revised, planned, implemented, and scheduled the Battalion Command Inspection Program 
â    Managed operational reporting, suspense tracking, movement requests, and force capabilities
â    Lead action officer for briefings, future operation plans, and force protection initiatives within the battalion
positions.title: Battalion Operations Officer

positions.description:
Directly supervised 120 personnel. Directs and controls mission operations. Responsible for mission planning, collective training, property accountability and operational readiness.  63 vehicles and MTOE equipment valued at over $12,000,000. 
â    Led 185 personnel to train and logistically support 2,000 cadets during West Pointâs Sumer Training
â  Trained and deployed 120 Soldiers to Iraq to provide Laundry and Shower support at 14 sites for over 20,000 personnel
â    Identified and turned in over $180K of excess parts to the supply system
positions.title: Commander

positions.description:
Logistics manager in the NATO Task Force in Afghanistan.  Managed the battle loss program replacing vehicles and equipment damaged in combat. Researched and collected equipment data through multiple databases. Assess logistics requirements on a continual basis to ensure seamless operations within the organization.
â    Authored a logistics guidebook for Task Force commanders to assist them sustain their operations
â    Tracked and replaced over 80 destroyed vehicles and 3 helicopters with a 14 day turnaround time from destruction
â    Planned a Task Force wide property accountability directive that accounted for $4 million of lost equipment 
â    Provided guidance and established policy for Command Supply discipline Program, Leave Behind Equipment, and directing lateral transfers to ensure proper allocation of Division equipment
positions.title: Deputy Supply Chief

positions.description:
Responsible for the quality surveillance, accountability and distribution of 3.8 million gallons of petroleum products. Resources unit weapons ranges, field exercises and movements. Responsible for the budget of unit's supply accounts. Directly supervises 30 personnel            
* Improved maintenance operations and policy that increased the operational readiness rate by 40%
* Planned, Developed, Resourced, and Executed three company level field training exercises
* Enhanced and maintained safety, security, and HAZMAT inspectable areas with commendable ratings
positions.title: Executive Officer

positions.description:
Responsible for providing bulk petroleum support across the full spectrum of military operations. Responsible for the operational employment, tactical deployment, maintenance, and accountability of nine fuel distribution systems and ground equipment valued in excess of 4 million dollars. Directly supervised 70 personnel
* Planned, Developed, Resourced, and Executed a platoon level field training exercise
* Developed a maintenance incentive plan that produced operational readiness rates over 90% 
* Executed multiple weapons ranges which qualified over 500 personnel throughout the battalion
positions.title: Platoon Leader

positions.description:
Responsible for the training, morale, health, and welfare of 182 personnel. Served as the maintenance and movement officer responsible for the maintenance and readiness of twenty vehicles and associated ground equipment. Supervised and coordinated the ground, air, or rail movement of the unit. Supervised all supply related actions to include requisitions, turn-ins, lateral transfers, and relief documents. Directly supervised 5 personnel.
* Increased unit's operational readiness rate from 85% to 96% within 3 months
* Improved unit's dental readiness rate above 95% exceeding Army Standards
* Supervised the deployment of over 50 personnel and 6 containers to Iraq
positions.title: Executive Officer
